trans-unit.source: A collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> objects in a list control.
This class cannot be inherited.
The ListItemCollection class represents a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects, in turn, represent the items displayed in list controls, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox>.

To programmatically retrieve <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects from a list control, use one of following methods: - Use the indexer to get a single <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> from the collection, using array notation.

- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the contents of the collection to a <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, which can then be used to get items from the collection.

- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object, which can then be used to get items from the collection.
- Use `foreach` (C#) or `For Each` (Visual Basic) to iterate through the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection.Count%2A> property specifies the total number of items in the collection, and is commonly used to determine the upper bound of the collection.
You can add and remove items from the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection.Add%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection.Remove%2A> methods.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> class using default values.
Appends a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> to the end of the collection that represents the specified string.
Use the Add method to append a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> to the end of the collection.
This implementation of the method creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> to represent the text specified by the `item` parameter.
This <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> is then appended to the collection.
A <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> that represents the item to add to the end of the collection.
Appends the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> to the end of the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection.Add%2A> method to append a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> to the end of the collection.
This implementation of the method takes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> specified by the `item` parameter and appends it to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> to append to the collection.
Adds the items in an array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> objects to the collection.
Use the AddRange method to add the items in the array of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects specified by the `items` parameter.
This allows you to add multiple <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects to the collection in a single step.
An array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> objects that contain the items to add to the collection.
items is .
Gets or sets the maximum number of items that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection"></xref> can store.
Use the Capacity property to specify or determine the maximum number of items that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> can store.
The maximum number of items that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection"></xref> can store.
Removes all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> objects from the collection.
Use the Clear method to remove all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection.Count%2A> property is also set to `0`.
> [!CAUTION] > When you use this method, all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects are removed from the collection.
You cannot undo this.
Determines whether the collection contains the specified item.
Use the Contains method to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> specified by the `item` parameter is in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> to search for in the collection.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the collection contains the specified item; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Copies the items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection"></xref> to the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>, starting with the specified index.
Use this method to copy the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>, starting at the specified index.
> [!NOTE] > The `array` parameter must be a zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>.
A zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection"></xref>.
The first index in the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> to receive the items.
Gets the number of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> objects in the collection.
Use the Count property to determine the number of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection>.
The Count property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound of the collection.
The number of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> objects in the collection.
Searches the collection for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text*> property that equals the specified text.

Use the FindByText method to search the collection for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> property that equals text specified by the `text` parameter.
This method performs a case-sensitive and culture-insensitive comparison.
This method does not do partial searches or wildcard searches.
If an item is not found in the collection using this criteria, `null` is returned.
The text to search for.
A that contains the text specified by the text parameter.
Searches the collection for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value*> property that contains the specified value.

Use the FindByValue method to search the collection for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property that contains value specified by the `value` parameter.
This method performs a case-sensitive and culture-insensitive comparison.
This method does not do partial searches or wildcard searches.
If an item is not found in the collection using this criteria, `null` is returned.
The value to search for.
A that contains the value specified by the value parameter.

Returns a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object that contains all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection"></xref>.

Use this method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> that can be iterated through to get each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection>.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator back to the initial position.

> [!NOTE] > After you create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> object or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.

A <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object that contains all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection"></xref>.
Determines the index value that represents the position of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> in the collection.
Use the IndexOf method to determine the index value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> specified by the `item` parameter in the collection.
If an item with this criteria is not found in the collection, `-1` is returned.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> to search for in the collection.
The index position of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> in the collection.
Inserts a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> which represents the specified string in the collection at the specified index location.
Use the Insert method to add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> to the collection at the index specified by the `index` parameter.
This implementation of the method creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> to represent the text specified by the `item` parameter.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> property of the new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> has the value `item`, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property has the value `null`.
This <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> is then inserted in the collection at the specified index.
The location in the collection to insert the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref>.
A <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> that represents the item to insert in the collection.
Inserts the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> in the collection at the specified index location.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection.Insert%2A> method to add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> to the collection at the index specified by the `index` parameter.
This implementation of the method takes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> specified by the `item` parameter and inserts it in the collection at the specified index.
The location in the collection to insert the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> to add to the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection"></xref> is read-only.
This property always returns `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> can be written to in all cases.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> for all cases.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread-safe).
This property is derived from <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> and is overridden to always return `false`.

For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> for all cases.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> at the specified index in the collection.
Use this indexer to get a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> at the specified index, using array notation.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> object at the specified index in the collection.
Removes a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> from the collection that represents the specified string.
Use the Remove method to remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> object from the collection.

This implementation of the method creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> object using the text in the `item` parameter and then removes this <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> from the collection.

The specified `item` parameter must match the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property of an existing <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> object, or no item is removed from the collection.
A <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> that represents the item to remove from the collection.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> from the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> from the collection.
This implementation of the method takes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> specified by the `item` parameter and removes it from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> to remove from the collection.
Removes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> at the specified index from the collection.
Use the RemoveAt method to remove the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> at the specified index from the collection.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> to remove.
Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection"></xref>.
The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> object itself.

For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IList.Add*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref:System.Object> to add to the <xref:System.Collections.IList>.
The index at which the item has been added.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IList.Contains*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref:System.Object> to locate in the <xref:System.Collections.IList>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Object> is found in the <xref:System.Collections.IList>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IList.IndexOf*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref:System.Object> to locate in the <xref:System.Collections.IList>.
The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IList.Insert*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index at which `value` should be inserted.
The <xref:System.Object> to insert into the <xref:System.Collections.IList>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IList.Item*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the element to get.
The element as the specified index.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IList.Remove*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref:System.Object> to remove from the <xref:System.Collections.IList>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the server control is tracking its view state change; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Loads the previously saved state.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection"></xref>.
Returns object containing state changes.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection"></xref>.
Starts tracking state of changes.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
